page.title: 15THE FOSSE WAY
page.content: The{Fosse Way}was one of the most important Roman roads in this country and runs through our block.It ran from Exeter (Roman Isca) to Lincoln (Lindum) and passed through the heart of present-day Leicestershire.The A46 follows the old road almost exactly from Leicester to Lincoln and much of the route survives south of Leicester on the way,through the Cotswolds,to Exeter.The road was originally built to link forts constructed soon after the Roman invasion of AD43;these were built to keep in check Celtic tribes hostile to Rome.The road became an important commercial route after its military use had ended.It has given its name to several local streets, firms ,schools and sports teams (Leicester City FC was once Leicester Fosse).There is a local"pub" on the Melton Road called the{Fosseway.
